website_summaries.verdict: An excellent sports watch that tracks many functions and is good-looking and comfortable to wear while running, working out, or enjoying a night on the town.
pros: Lightweight, stylish, and comfortable, yet it's loaded with tracking capabilities including GPS, heart rate, and training goals
Also tracks numerous activities, including swimming, cycling, and running
Gets impressive battery life per charge
cons: Downloads and updates can be frustrating, as the software has been known to hav compatibility issues

customer_reviews.title: Beware that you may get the APAC (Asian) model of ...
customer_reviews.text: Beware that you may get the APAC (Asian) model of the watch and not the ROW (Rest of World) from this listing. The main downside is that firmware updates (including bug fixes and new features) from Garmin will lag up to 6 months behind the ROW version. Additionally, Garmin may refuse to service your watch if you do happen to run into issues due to the version difference while living in a Western country. BUY AT YOUR OWN RISK. THIS WAS NOT ADVERTISED IN THE ITEM DESCRIPTION, BUT IS WHY THIS LISTING IS CHEAPER THAN RETAIL/OTHER FORERUNNER 935 LISTINGS.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: This watch was sold as a "ROW" version (Western version) ...
customer_reviews.text: This watch was sold as a "ROW" version (Western version) but it is actually a APAC (Asia Pacific) version of the watch, which limits the firmware availability, app usability, etc. DO NOT BUY from this seller!
customer_reviews.author: Liz Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Careful of Model.
customer_reviews.text: I had a lot of problems with this watch and called Garmin for support. They confirmed that this watch was the Asian Market Version. Which doesn’t allow for software updates. Thankfully they are going to help me. Make sure this isn’t the Asian Market Version as you’ll be stuck with software and no updates available.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Forster

customer_reviews.title: Same as many.... Asian version. ...
customer_reviews.text: Same as many....Asian version....can you advertise the correct info on what you are selling? Thx
customer_reviews.author: Cristian M.

customer_reviews.title: Item received was Asia Pacific model
customer_reviews.text: The item that I received was the Asia Pacific model, the back of the box is pictured in the photo. You'll notice that the GPS battery life is listed on the box as 21 hours, but the listing says 24 hour battery life. This isn't apparent in the listing, but please be aware that this may not be the same edition that you are expecting.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew W.

customer_reviews.title: Asian software on the watch.  Not supported in US.
customer_reviews.text: Warning. Without warning I received an Asian version. It would not update past 8.0. Garmin is now on 9.5. The watch face began showing "pixelated" display, froze and went black. It was a great fitness watch...up to that point in time!
customer_reviews.author: T MACCHEROLA

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware. This is the Asian version of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. This is the Asian version of the watch is and not supported by Garmin. False advertisement. Don't be fooled
customer_reviews.author: Kemper Dotson

customer_reviews.title: Confirmed APAC version
customer_reviews.text: Received it 6 days ago. As others warned this is the APAC version. New update installed yesterday...ver 9.70. Overall it works but it’s had a few problems with Bluetooth losing connectivity before the update. After the update wrist HR stoppped recording history until Watch was restarted several times. Testing for a few more days but not sure this 935 is staying on my wrist much longer. Update--- Called Garmin support - verified advertised item number (amazon's site) compared to what I received - wrong item was sent. Garmin agreed to replace the Amazon purchased Apac with the ROW version I intended to purchase. Excellent support! EXCELLENT! Received my new Garmin 935 and couldn't be happier. Best activity/training companion ever.
customer_reviews.author: YM1967

customer_reviews.title: Great Product with 2 versions
customer_reviews.text: 1.2" screen which is easily seen in the light and a lot of sensors in a very light package. Great Sport watch! My purchase was from "Amazing Deals - Prime". Called Garmin when the watch arrived to check the serial number. Unfortunate, the watch was APAC (Asian Pacific model) and no warranty is available in the USA. No software uploads, as this was an APAC (Asian version) instead of ROW (US model). Thankfully, Amazon will return my money and will need to re-purchase..
customer_reviews.author: DRS MD

customer_reviews.title: Not a ROW Garmin watch
customer_reviews.text: I like the watch! It is a pretty good model but: I could not find any information that this is APAC version and not a ROW version. The main problem is that I can not have the latest software version on my Garmin. I bought last August and I just figured out today as I am checking with my friends and they are on the 10.10 version and I am on 9.70. I know that I paid a little cheaper, but I did not know this could happen. Otherwise, I would buy the ROW version. This is bad for Amazon as we fell that we can not trust on products we buy here
customer_reviews.author: Alexandre Brustello

customer_reviews.title: U.S. Version
customer_reviews.text: I have been keeping an eye out for an upgraded multi-sport watch for a long time and finally decided on the 935. I found them a bit cheaper on Amazon than on retail sites so was worried when I saw some negative reviews. I confirmed with the seller that it was the ROW (U.S.) and not the Asian version. Haven't had very long but everything so far seems to work great. I downloaded the latest software version from my computer no problem. Downloaded an additional watch face with Connect IQ. I like the feel of the watch and that the face is "always on." Will update review after a couple months of use.
customer_reviews.author: A.J. Weber

customer_reviews.title: Received the ROW version!
customer_reviews.text: I received the ROW version, not the APAC many buyers said they were getting from Amazon. I also bought a Fenix 5 now for sale at 350. Funtionality is the same for both, the Fenix doesn't have Wifi but for syncing bluetooth works just fine (and fast! not like for example my old Polar M430). If you are not worried about HR missreadings from the Fenix because of its weight while bumping in your wrist, its much nicer then the 935. The look&feel of the Fenix makes the full plastic 935 looks like a toy.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian Montes

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth Issues Make this watch useless
customer_reviews.text: When I first purchased the watch it worked flawlessly. It did a great job of tracking runs and easily uploading them to Strava. About 6 months in I ran into connectivity issues on bluetooth. Every few weeks I would have to uninstall the watch from Garmin's proprietary phone app and then reinstall it. Eventually this turned into a daily process and it was just easier to get an Apple Watch that just worked. It may not have the detailed analysis that Garmin offers, but I never had issues with it recording a run. I'm not promoting Apple here, just anything but this watch.
customer_reviews.author: C. Weightman

customer_reviews.title: An amazing piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: I love my Garmin! I'm an enthusiastic athlete and this is a terrific tool for keeping track of workouts, as well as sleep and other things. After more than 35 years of serious distance running and multi-sport training, I have never consistently tracked my heart rate and see now how useful (and undoubtedly healthful) that feature will be. I've only been using the watch for a few days but so far I am impressed with its ease of use. I was worried that the setup would be overly taxing, but it turned out to be very intuitive to set up and operate. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine H.

customer_reviews.title: When this watch works it is great...however
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to the Garmin Forerunner 935 after using the vivoactive for a couple of years. At first I like the watch and I was really impressed; however, after a couple of months I started having issues with it. Specifically, it does not charge, or it charges then it goes to 2% and dies or it reads that it is charging and after an hour or so it is still on 16%. In terms of functionality this is a great watch but I would not buy this again. Reaching Garmin support is way harder than it needs to be and after 5 months my watch is basically unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Powell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Tri watch... almost
customer_reviews.text: Great watch! No HRM on wrist for swimming. Performance stats (fitness and load, Vo2 max, etc) only work when you are consistent with outside running and cycling (cycling maybe inside), so it is not as useful as it could be for me since I swim/run, and sometimes run inside. I also strength training for better running mechanics and the strength training “activity” portion is clunky, I still need to get used to working out with it. Otherwise I do like it, just wish the HRM tracked while swimming OR, that the HRM TRI or HRM SWIM had more consistent performance to go with this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia M

customer_reviews.title: Best Garmin watch I had to date
customer_reviews.text: Great watch! I had many Garmin watches before, this is yet the best one. Love all the stuff it tracks and also the option to pick the watch faces from an app. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Nathalie B

customer_reviews.title: You’ll receive the Asian version, not ROW
customer_reviews.text: Got the Asian version, despite that not being noted in the description. Promptly returned and ordered direct from Garmin. BUYER BEWARE.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mizzell

customer_reviews.title: Great watch!
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch! I had an the Forerunner 620 before and it was just okay. Not great battery life, bad charging system that required constant replacement and connectivity issues. This watch is the opposite. I use it all the time now as it counts steps, analyzes sleep, and provides a long list of other metrics. I absolutely love this watch! And it provides great insight into my daily running. If you're a runner or participate in most other athletic activities, this is the watch for you!
customer_reviews.author: MerrickM

customer_reviews.title: Best Forerunner available!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 5th Garmin Forerunner I have owned and it is by far my favorite. It has one of the best batteries of all of the models I own and the running data that can be collected from this model is amazing. It is a very durably built watch that has everyday wear functionality. I also love that it connects with the Strava live segments which gives me a great competitive edge in competing for the top segment time!
customer_reviews.author: Juston Wickham

customer_reviews.title: Great fitness watch, with a good look and feel
customer_reviews.text: Have had a Garmin fitness watch for years. I finally convinced myself to upgrade with a new one. Looked at Apple and all the others, but kept coming back to Garmin. This particular watch and model works well for me at a good price for all it offers.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen M Dagostino

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional in every aspect
customer_reviews.text: This product surpassed all of my expectations. I expected to have to charge this product more than I actually have to, expected it to have more bugs and problems than I actually have encountered. I have not encountered any problems whatsoever. I'm completely satisfied with my purchase and I use it all the time. It's fits all my needs and responds to all my demands. I love just going on a run now more then ever since I have this watch. It makes every workout and my progression tracking so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Michel

customer_reviews.title: Great triathlon or ultra watch
customer_reviews.text: Great for multiple sport tracking and custom activity generation. Inter-activity data screen customizability is top notch. Altimeter and GPS/GLONASS tracking is spot on and the battery lasts long enough for a full day of punishment (aka fun). Links up seamlessly with Strava and TrainingPeaks through Garmin Connect. And the band has a nice tab to keep it from slipping out of the loop and flopping all over during the swim. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Wicks

customer_reviews.title: If you can get past the steep price tag, it's well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE this watch! Very easy and intuitive to use. Fully waterproof so swimming with it isn't an issue. It does seem a little on the bulky side but it makes up for that with an INSANE battery life! I usually go about a week without having to charge it and that is with using the active GPS feature to track my bike rides/runs for about an hour each day.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Light watch with many features.
customer_reviews.text: This has received excellent reviews so I had to purchase it. The page showed the ROS version of the watch but I received the APAC version. It needed to be updated and that was a difficult process with Bluetooth. Perhaps the difficulty with updates has something to do with the version. It’s a light watch and that’s good. Packed with functionality, just buyer beware of the versions.
customer_reviews.author: Gerken

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Asian market
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in finding out this was an Asian market item. Software is terrible and will not update to new software. Watch will not work. Called Garmin thankfully they will help me out. Super customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great features, terrible reliability
customer_reviews.text: Great features and battery life. Terrible reliability. Altitude broke after 6 months, returned and fixed on warranty. Replacement altimeter broke after another 7 months. And now the plastic around the HR sensor is cracking and falling apart, compromising water resistance eventually. Watch is only good for 6 months or so if you are active, and boards have a lot of complaints. But great watch when it works.
customer_reviews.author: ken

customer_reviews.title: WOW! WOW! WOW! Battery life is blowing me away!
customer_reviews.text: Besides the battery life that is beyond my expectations (2 weeks or longer with 3-4 workouts with GPS each week), the training advice has been helping me rebuild consistency in my training and helping me to push a bit more than I usually do while keeping me from over-training. The sleep tracking has been great as well. Highly recommend this to anyone looking at improving their fitness with a fitness watch.
customer_reviews.author: S. Andert

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY FROM THIS SELLER
customer_reviews.text: I had an issue with the HR monitor cracking/flacking and HR inaccuracy. Unfortunately, I contacted Garmin and they wouldn't help me as they said this was an "Asian variant". No where in the description does it say you are receiving an "Asian variant" watch. I might be out $400+ dollars on a watch that lasted 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie L VanOveren

customer_reviews.title: Good but Impossible to pair with brand new Iphone 8
customer_reviews.text: Good product, the quality that you expect from a Garmin. The only terrible part is that it's impossible to connect with the new Iphone8, i tried many times, updated both the app and the IOS and nothing... It worked perfectly with my android phone, so if you have an iphone I would think twice before buying this product
customer_reviews.author: Giuliano baptistella

customer_reviews.title: Does everything you need and more
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife for Christmas. She hasn't taken it off since then. It does everything she needs for running and can do extra's like receive your texts and phone notifications through blue tooth. It wears well for every day use not just for running. She has used it during marathons and for her training for marathons. This model is a bit bigger than the Fenix model but my wife preferred the look of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sports watch with some smartwatch capabilities
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. Originally wanted a watch to use only during sports, but ended up using it full-time because of the great features for everyday monitoring. I was on the fence between this one and an Apple Watch, but the 10-day battery (or up to 2 weeks if you don't do a lot of sports) is a great advantage of the Garmin. Obviously the Garmin has less apps, but this is the perfect combination for me between a a great sports watch and the basic functionalities of a smart watch (alerts, health, audio controls, etc) without all the annoying clutter. The only thing missing is the ability to load music or podcasts directly to the watch.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Beelen

customer_reviews.title: APAC version
customer_reviews.text: Despite reading the reviews on here about some people getting the APAC version instead of the ROW, I figured I’d roll the dice in hopes of getting the ROW. Instead I got the APAC and will now be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch with awesome battery life
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it for one month and I am really enjoying all the fitness features. These are good as a smart watch too. The battery life is amazing. The only two complaints I have: 1) The GPS takes long time to lock (we are all spoiled by AGPS phones, but this is a pure GPS device that relies on satellites only) 2) The plastic and the glass are very soft. I already scratched both of them on the rocks. But we do not buy these things for looks, do we?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: May cause skin irritation
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the watch at first. The sleep tracking function isn’t as accurate as the Huawei Band 2 Pro, but it had some nice fearures that made up for that. I was expecting it to be a touchscreen watch, but was sadly disappointed. In spite of that, I would have kept it if not for the fact that after wearing it for about a week, I decide to move it to my right wrist for a few hours. I moved it back before going to bed and thought little of it until I saw a rash where it had been on my right wrist. This persisted several days before beginning to peel.
customer_reviews.author: Hmong Boy

customer_reviews.title: Scratches too easily for an every day watch but it's a solid training tool
customer_reviews.text: Scratches too easily for an every day watch but it's a solid training tool. If you want to wear a watch every day, get the Fenix 5 with Sapphire Glass. If you want a great running/multisport watch that you don't want to wear 24/7, get this. I've had it for a month and it's already picked up two deep scratches but love running & training with it.
customer_reviews.author: Corri

customer_reviews.title: AMAZON CHEATS THE CLIENTS
customer_reviews.text: I received a defective product, by the way it was an asian version of the watch and Now on I have spent more than 550 USD trying to return this product, and I don't have neither the article or the money. THANKS AMAZON!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Juan Esteban Salas

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight awesome multi-sport watch
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. I run, swim, bike, lift weights and this watch does it all. And, it is so light weight. No metal to clank around. Battery life for weeks. Without using GPS much i can get two weeks out of a single charge. If i train hard and ride with GpS on i can get at least a week. And i wear it almost 24 / 7. Works with my cadence monitor and tri heart rate monitor without flaws. Would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Trauma NP

customer_reviews.title: So far it is a perfect upgrade to my Forerunner 630
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this as an elective upgrade to my Garmin Forerunner 630. So far it is a perfect upgrade. Paired with the HRM-Tri I really appreciate the Running Dynamics. Now can it turn me into a 3 hour Marathon Runner?? I like that the UI involves buttons rather then touch screen (630), works better for me. Will see how the next 3-4 months works out.
customer_reviews.author: Bones27

customer_reviews.title: expensive but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: expensive but worth it. i am coming to it after trying to spend less with a suunto spartan trainer. that watch is great hardware wise but the software ecosystem from garming is just several steps ahead of suunto at this point.
customer_reviews.author: kk

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: A great product. I've used it for a day or two now and it's really effective and versatile. I saw reviews from people who have had this for over a year and it seems to be very durable (even after triathlon training) but I bought a warranty just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Grey

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared for features that cannot be disarmed
customer_reviews.text: Certain "features" are difficult to turn off. Seems to be a disconnect between Garmins ability to grasp someone who puchases a multisport watch is not interested in in counting basic daily steps like those who sit on coach eating Cheetos all day.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Stavvy Sales Sells Asia Model
customer_reviews.text: Stavvy Sales is delivering Asia model still. Not US, even though the model number, spec sheet, and description are all based off US model!! Waste of my time!
customer_reviews.author: College Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great watch.
customer_reviews.text: Nearly two years since buying this watch and I still love it. Get the watch face protector, it’s saved me a few times now. Bought this to replace my vivoactive HR when it broke (failed adter being submerged in water). What an awesome upgrade!! Worth every penny. Lighter than the fenix version and measures every workout metric I could ask for. I’m an amateur athlete. Cycling and running are my primary exercises. I also use it for lifting but it’s not as good for this purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.  Big improvement over Garmin 620.
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves this watch. She previously had the Garmin 620. This one tells her when she has phone text or email notifications. She likes that she does not have to wear a heart rate monitor. Much better data output for training when paired with the app.
customer_reviews.author: DTanner

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: I love the Garmin 935. Everything I expected and more. Highly recommend this watch for anyone training for triathlons. The battery life is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: James H. Hooper

customer_reviews.title: Faulty displays
customer_reviews.text: This is a great watch feature wise. The battery life with the always on display is incredible. It's comfortable to wear and the tracking features are the best in the industry. However, there is a known issue with the display failing on these and if you are outside your warranty you'll have to pay to have it fixed. For watches that sell at the price they do new, they should really last more than a year and a half. Especially considering these are meant for serious multi-sport athletes.
customer_reviews.author: David Bass

customer_reviews.title: Long Battery life
customer_reviews.text: Love the light weight and comfortable feel of this watch - as don't typically like wearing watches, chains, or rings. But even more impressive is the long battery life... bought it almost a month ago and have only charged it ONCE since the initial charge. Not sure how accurate any watch/wearable is for tracking sleep, steps, or heart rate, but do appreciate having a view to trends and the impact from taking HIIT classes.
customer_reviews.author: Dan M.

customer_reviews.title: 1 week battery, multi functions, ok for US & Asia
customer_reviews.text: My first Garmin so still getting to know the functions . I switched from TomTom which has very easy to use functions . Love how the battery lasts 6-7 days. Been using it for 2 months and so far so good. Used in US and Asia and so far maps and gps have been good. Used for cycling , running , swimming in the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Ri

customer_reviews.title: May be asian version, unsupported in USA. Verify before buying.
customer_reviews.text: Beware, you may receive an Asian version of this watch from the seller, which is not supported in the US. I guess that’s fine if you plan on using the watch in Asia. Rather unethical to leave this information out. Watched worked fine otherwise, but had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos F.

customer_reviews.title: Reliability, data, ease of use.
customer_reviews.text: Review? It's the best multisport watch on the market, hands down. If you are looking at this watch, you already know this, pull the trigger and spend the money for one of the best pieces of equipment you will use in your gear.
customer_reviews.author: BManley

customer_reviews.title: Loving this watch
customer_reviews.text: Training for a half iron and loving this watch. Still trying to figure out all the features but it’s been great so far and easy to adapt to.
customer_reviews.author: Jason B

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, but ordered ROW and received APAC
customer_reviews.text: Be aware of the Firemall LLC seller, it sells APAC version (as they say - US version). Anyway, the watch is great. The problem is the firmware, after 2 months of the v12 release, there is still no update for APAC version.
customer_reviews.author: wadym

customer_reviews.title: I love this watch
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch, the battery can last 2weeks even I run 2-3times, the notification on the watch is very useful too, I don’t need to bring out my phone to read messages. I haven’t used the swimming mood yet, very looking forward to it
customer_reviews.author: Tiancai

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Works so much more reliably than the Fenix 5. This is the watch for serious runners, or anyone wishing accuracy for GPS running.
customer_reviews.author: ChiWks

customer_reviews.title: Clunker
customer_reviews.text: Unreliable....just google green triangle of death... GTOD...stuck with a $500 cluncker...
customer_reviews.author: Always Summer Here

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I love this and it works great without GPS the battery will last 2 weeks of constant wear logging 2 one hour workouts per day. Great for taking swims and provides great use feedback on progress
customer_reviews.author: chase sunden

customer_reviews.title: Light, great battery life, the app is amazing, design is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Light, great battery life, the app is amazing, a great update to my previous watch (I used to have a Polar V800 , the battery died after 4 years of very intense use). Cons: I think its very pricey. Hope it lasts for at least the same 4 years my Polar V800 lasted.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: This is APAC version, but still good
customer_reviews.text: Great watch. It is the APAC version. It still works great plus it saved me a lot money. I haven't noticed any problems with it being the APAC version. I run with it every day fro the past few months
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Perfect all around smart watch
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch, all functions work great and track as promised. Golf app works better than some dedicated watches and even provides shot distances automatically. GPS is fantastic and battery life is very good. Watch faces are numerous and without too many issues, what's not to like!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Clark

customer_reviews.title: Can do all you have read and even more
customer_reviews.text: I had previously a forerunner 235 and was looking for a triathlon sport watch with a big battery capacity and this one is just incredible. You can do absolutly all you can imagine even retrieve your phone if you have lost it, or parachute. Obviously nothing to say about the sport functions. May be a bit complicated when you want to enter in the detailled setting but with so mainy possibilities it's quite normal. Well done Garmin!
customer_reviews.author: Esteban

customer_reviews.title: The FR935 has worked great providing accurate gps tracks and the instantaneous pace is ...
customer_reviews.text: Considered the Fenix 5, but went with the FR935. The FR935 has worked great providing accurate gps tracks and the instantaneous pace is far better than the F3. I owned a Fenix3 and FR935 is 1/2 the wieght as the F3 and tracks much better. I purchased the exuun glass protector with the FR935.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M.

customer_reviews.title: Cool Features, Easy to Learn, and Easy to Function
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a Garmin 235 since 2013, and this is my first watch upgrade. This watch is easy to learn, and easy to function. I had no desire to upgrade from just simple GPS until recently, but I am now fully hooked on using the additional features of this watch. The bluetooth is also an awesome feature. I have this watch for ~2 months, and would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Have upgraded several times and have enjoyed them all
customer_reviews.text: Have been a Garmin lover since the Forerunner 110. Have upgraded several times and have enjoyed them all! Bought the 935 specifically for the Triathlon mode. I have a small wrist and fits fine, not too big. Happy customer!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Greenwaldt

customer_reviews.title: Won’t stay connected to phone/room forever to sync
customer_reviews.text: It literally took 2 hours to get Garmin Connect to sync with my phone and watch and then when it was finally connected it connected/disconnected every minute. Extremely frustrating, I was super excited for this watch but sadly I’ll be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew Correa

customer_reviews.title: My favorite Garmin!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this watch! It is big enough to see the dial clearly, but very lightweight! The battery life is awesome. I use the tri strap with it to get swimming and additional run & bike stats!
customer_reviews.author: A. Guiliani

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from Suunto Ambit3
customer_reviews.text: - feels nice on the arm - pool count is accurate - gps is fast - gps in open water swim is accurate - many faces and apps - hr read is good
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: By far the best
customer_reviews.text: The best triathlon watch by far It has everything you need
customer_reviews.author: Felipe

customer_reviews.title: Garmin is the best, really
customer_reviews.text: One thing I really like about this product is the weight. It is virtually net zero pounds. All functionality is great as well. Really wish I forked out the money for the paying and Spotify features. This is the best workout watch around.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Heart rate monitor fails often.
customer_reviews.text: This watch is fine, except the heart rate monitor does not work sometimes. My actual HR when this photo was taken was 82 - not 163. Inasmuch as much of my training and feedback from the watch are based on HR, this is not cool. I’d say this is an issue 50% of the time. This is my 2nd 935. My first was replaced when the altimeter stopped working. Garmin replaced with no hassle.
customer_reviews.author: william d

customer_reviews.title: Flawless
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. It works perfectly without any issues. The battery life is amazing. It just goes to show how happy a person can be when a manufacturer does it right the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Great running watch
customer_reviews.text: Great running watch. Syncs automatically as soon as I get back from my run, and can instantly read the performance summary on my smartphone, tablet, or browser. Tons of useful data.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Not as user-friendly as the 735xt, but a lot more accurate--and a terrific battery life!
customer_reviews.text: Slow, but with great features--almost too many to keep straight. Not as easy to use as the 735xt, but more accurate and with an incredible battery-- a really nice running buddy!
customer_reviews.author: lewes

customer_reviews.title: ... for more than a week now and I absolutely love it. I use it all the time and ...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had the Garmin Forerunner 935 for more than a week now and I absolutely love it. I use it all the time and I rarely have to charge it. I’m glad I bought this watch over the fenix because the lightness of it and it does everything the fenix does but the price is cheaper. I definitely recommend buying this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Breanna

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Price!
customer_reviews.text: Does everything I want and more! I've logged just shy of 20,000 miles the last 12 years and wish I had this one earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The battery last surprisingly long
customer_reviews.text: I have been a long-time garmin client, and I upgraded my 735xt to the 935. It was a great move, specially that I bought it for a reduced price (March 2020)
customer_reviews.author: Al J

customer_reviews.title: Very good , I received the RoW version
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well for me. I use to have a forerunner 735 that got broken and decided to buy a 935. I use to do some cardio workouts and swim a lot and it's a really useful watch for this. Better battery than 735 and more parameters. Very satisfied with Garmin for my open water and pool swims.
customer_reviews.author: Diego Rodrigues

customer_reviews.title: Forerunner 935
customer_reviews.text: Debated between getting the 935 and the 735, but very happy I went with the 935. Probably won’t utilize all the features it offers (fishing, golf, etc.) but extremely happy with the battery life, screen brightness, weight, and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: To big of a face for me
customer_reviews.text: I like it but just to big of a face for my wrist. I'm sticking w 645. Other then working out I would not wear.
customer_reviews.author: Thairaven1

customer_reviews.title: Yes Its Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband who is a serious runner and he loves it. Uses it day in and day out, especially for runs. He loves the phone integration and the stats too. Definitely worth the price tag!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Love this watch because there is virtually nothing it doesn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch because there is virtually nothing it doesn't tell you. You need to figure out what to do with the amount of data this watch sends back
customer_reviews.author: Mike Castellan

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Great running watch. Used it for marathon training. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: C. A.

customer_reviews.title: Garmin addict
customer_reviews.text: The watch was easy to setup. It has all the features I could ever want in a running watch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Fast service.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband for Christmas. He had a previous version and wanted this one for tris. Also tells his stress level and helps keep him on track with his calorie count and activity level.
customer_reviews.author: Tona Simpson

customer_reviews.title: This watch does everything!! I depend on it ...
customer_reviews.text: This watch does everything!! I depend on it more than my phone now. If your training buy this watch. You won’t be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: Great for tracking workouts. No issues no matter what you are doing. Make sure you have solid GPS before running. Fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Kaminski

customer_reviews.title: Great watch and insights
customer_reviews.text: This watch is by far the best purchase I have made for Triathalon training. It lasts forever in GPS mode and provides key insights I was missing while using the Vivoactive.
customer_reviews.author: Celeste

customer_reviews.title: Does it all, and well!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my need. I can run, swim, ride, walk and even golf (a bonus) with it. Impressive battery life. The health stats are better that Fitbit. Not only I replaced my old GPS watch, but also the Fitbit Charge I was using for years.
customer_reviews.author: Andres Suarez

customer_reviews.title: Not product meant for North America
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the “Base” style watch from Firemall LLC and received the Asia Pacific version of the watch, not the Rest of World (ROW) version that works in North America. No where on the product description does it not that Firewall LLC is selling the Asia Pacific version of the watch.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Nice improvement from the 735xt
customer_reviews.text: Nice improvement from the 735xt, which is also a great device but this model improves on battery life and additional functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great multi sport watch!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Don’t fall for one of these cheap knockoffs by COROS claiming to beat Garmin!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Salmon

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best watch out on the market
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best watch out on the market! Easy to use. This watch will take any runner to the next level with all the built in features and the other features with Garmin Connect.
customer_reviews.author: BH

customer_reviews.title: Great features and connectivity
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, great feature set and connectivity via Connect IQ. GPS locks quickly and track is quite accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Alang

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my husband for Christmas. He loves it and has run with it everyday since...
customer_reviews.author: Tami Emery

customer_reviews.title: Great product indeed!
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I am EXTREMELY happy with my Garmin Forerunner 935 purchase. The only concern I have is that the sleep logging is not as accurate as my Samsung Fit Pro 2 was.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Joynt

customer_reviews.title: Amazing watch for sport lovers
customer_reviews.text: Amazing watch, every day i find out a new function which i was not aware of. Ideal for all sports (also weight lifting), integrates easily with Iphone and has a nice design. Goes very well along w/ the colorful bands.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas P. Netto

customer_reviews.title: Battery life
customer_reviews.text: Very nice!! This is my second Garmin and I am really happy with the quality of the device. I strongly recommend if you are looking for a running device!!
customer_reviews.author: Carmo Junior

customer_reviews.title: Exceed my expctations
customer_reviews.text: I just love this waths, I hope to take advantage of its features as many as it has
customer_reviews.author: Humberto Palacio

customer_reviews.title: ... avid runner the only problem I have with thiswatch is that I have to take it off to ...
customer_reviews.text: As an avid runner the only problem I have with this watch is that I have to take it off to charge it. It is that good. The menus are well organized and easy to navigate and the feedback it gives me after each run has been a tremendous help in reaching my goals. You need this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Christensen

customer_reviews.title: I have had it for a week now and LOVE IT. Used it for my 1st Triathlon and ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had it for a week now and LOVE IT. Used it for my 1st Triathlon and replaced my 920xt
customer_reviews.author: Indalecio Del Real

product_meta.title: Garmin Forerunner 935 Running GPS Unit (Black)
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style:BaseWho cares that forerunner 935 gives you dialed in data such as dynamics for running, cycling and swimming, wrist based Heart rate, training status, ftp and vo2 Max? a dedicated athlete like you who’s ready to Beat yesterday. This premium GPS running/Triathlon Watch helps you fine tune your training and recovery to be a better athlete. For the competitor in you, it features Starve live segments so you can turn every run or ride into a virtual competition. For the “looks count, too” in you, interchangeable bands let you quickly change bands for a new Sport or style. Forerunner 935 also has smart notifications, automatic uploads and connect IQ compatibility for custom Watch faces and apps.
feature_bullets: Offers advanced running and multisport Features in a comfortable watch you can wear all day, and it only weighs 49 grams
Provides elevation changes with a built in barometer; altimeter and electronic compass help you keep your bearings
Evaluates your training status to indicate if you’re undertraining or overdoing it and offers additional performance monitoring Features
Premium GPS running/triathlon watch with wrist based heart rate;Strap material : silicone ; Smartphone compatibility : iPhone, Android, Windows; designed for sale and support in North America only
Provides advanced dynamics for running, cycling and swimming, including ground contact time balance, stride length and more. Bezel Material Fiber reinforced polymer

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars847 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
